dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, another rough day out there for the markets, huh? I mean, just when you think it can't get worse...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, another rough day out there for the markets, huh? I mean, just when you think it can't get worse...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The stock market continued to rally higher on Wednesday, as the S&P 500 hit a new record close and the Dow rose almost 500 points, with stocks now recovering most of their losses related to the coronavirus during the past two weeks.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, absolutely, Host_A. The S&P 500, like, plunged to a new record low. We're talking 3290.00, which is, um, a 1.1% dip just on Wednesday.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, absolutely, Host_A. The S and P five hundred, like, plunged to a new record low. We're talking three thousand, two hundred ninety point zero zero, which is, um, a one point one percent dip just on Wednesday.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The S&P 500 index rose 1.1% on Wednesday, hitting a new record closing high of 3334.69 and fully erasing its losses stemming from fears over the coronavirus and its impact on businesses and the global economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And the Dow wasn't far behind, right? I saw it was down, like, almost 600 points. That's a pretty significant hit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the Dow wasn't far behind, right? I saw it was down, like, almost six hundred points. That's a pretty significant hit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Dow Jones Industrial Average jumped nearly 500 points, gaining 1.7% and putting the index back within reach of its pre-coronavirus levels.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. A 2.7% drop, pushing it even further away from those pre-coronavirus levels, which feels like ages ago now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. A two point seven percent drop, pushing it even further away from those pre-coronavirus levels, which feels like ages ago now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Dow Jones Industrial Average jumped nearly 500 points, gaining 1.7% and putting the index back within reach of its pre-coronavirus levels.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But here's the kicker, uh, the Nasdaq actually managed to buck the trend a bit, didn't it? Up 1.4%?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But here's the kicker, uh, the Nasdaq actually managed to buck the trend a bit, didn't it? Up one point four percent?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Nasdaq Composite index, on the other hand, lagged both the Dow and S&P 500, gaining only 0.4%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It did! And that's largely thanks to Tesla, actually. Their shares just soared, like, nearly 20% yesterday.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It did! And that's largely thanks to Tesla, actually. Their shares just soared, like, nearly twenty percent yesterday.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Nasdaq was held back in large part because Tesla shares, which soared up to 50% earlier this week, plunged by almost 20% on Wednesdayits worst day ever...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Wait, Tesla? The same Tesla that was down 50% earlier this week?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, Tesla? The same Tesla that was down fifty percent earlier this week?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...Tesla shares, which soared up to 50% earlier this week, plunged by almost 20% on Wednesday...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: The very same. Apparently, news about the coronavirus boosting production in their Shanghai factory really, uh, gave it a shot in the arm. Best day ever for them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The very same. Apparently, news about the coronavirus boosting production in their Shanghai factory really, uh, gave it a shot in the arm. Best day ever for them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...plunged by almost 20% on Wednesdayits worst day everamid reports that the coronavirus would impact production and deliveries at its factory in Shanghai, China.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. But still, what a roller coaster. Even with that jump, I read they're still down, like, 70% for 2020?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. But still, what a roller coaster. Even with that jump, I read they're still down, like, seventy percent for twenty twenty?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Even with Wednesdays record plunge, Tesla stock is still up more than 70% in 2020.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's wild. And if that wasn't enough bad news for the day, the ADP and Moody's report came out, showing U.S. private payrolls only rose by 191,000 in January.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's wild. And if that wasn't enough bad news for the day, the A D P and Moody's report came out, showing U S private payrolls only rose by one hundred ninety one thousand in January.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...a report from ADP and Moodys Analytics, which said that U.S. private payrolls rose by 291,000 in January...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Which, um, was way less than expected, right? Smallest gain in almost five years. Just adds to the gloom.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, um, was way less than expected, right? Smallest gain in almost five years. Just adds to the gloom.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...U.S. private payrolls rose by 291,000 in Januaryalmost twice the expected number and the biggest monthly payroll gain in almost five years.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. So, we're looking at all three major indexes now posting losses for the third day in a row. A real continuation of that big sell-off we saw last Friday.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. So, we're looking at all three major indexes now posting losses for the third day in a row. A real continuation of that big sell-off we saw last Friday.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: All three major indexes have now posted gains for the third day in a row, marking a recovery from a huge sell-off on coronavirus fears last Friday...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, but remember last Friday the Dow actually *gained* 600 points? It's just so volatile.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, but remember last Friday the Dow actually gained six hundred points? It's just so volatile.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...last Friday when the Dow shed 600 points and posted its worst single-day drop since August 2019...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I know, it's a whiplash. And the S&P 500, um, has now fully lost all its coronavirus-related gains, turning negative for 2020. Down 1.2% for the year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, it's a whiplash. And the S and P five hundred, um, has now fully lost all its coronavirus-related gains, turning negative for twenty twenty. Down one point two percent for the year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The S&P 500 has now fully recovered from its coronavirus-related losses, turning positive for 2020 so far. The index is now up 1.2% for the year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, you're saying, like, the Dow is actually the best performer year-to-date, up 4.1%?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, you're saying, like, the Dow is actually the best performer year-to-date, up four point one percent?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The best-performing index so far is the Nasdaq, however, thanks to its 4.1% rise in 2020. The Dow, on the other hand, is attempting to climb back from earlier losses and turn positive for the year: It is now down 0.2% so far this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Believe it or not, yeah. The Nasdaq's trying to hold onto positive, but it's close.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Believe it or not, yeah. The Nasdaq's trying to hold onto positive, but it's close.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The best-performing index so far is the Nasdaq, however, thanks to its 4.1% rise in 2020.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It really feels like a perfect storm, doesn't it? Coronavirus fears, mixed earnings, and, uh, some folks saying the market's overvalued.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really feels like a perfect storm, doesn't it? Coronavirus fears, mixed earnings, and, uh, some folks saying the market's overvalued.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A Perfect Storm: Coronavirus, Major Earnings Reports And An Overvalued Market Could Slam Investors This Week

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Absolutely. Adam Crisafulli from Vital Knowledge, he, uh, put it pretty well. Said the "bearish narrative" that's been lurking since late 2019 is "firmly back in control."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Adam Crisafulli from Vital Knowledge, he, uh, put it pretty well. Said the bearish narrative that's been lurking since late twenty nineteen is firmly back in control.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The bullish narrative thats been driving stocks since late 2019 is firmly back in control of the tape after taking a brief pause during the final days of January.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And he's predicting, like, those coronavirus-linked work accelerations and travel restrictions are gonna have a *material* impact on global growth. It's not just a passing thing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And he's predicting, like, those coronavirus-linked work accelerations and travel restrictions are gonna have a material impact on global growth. It's not just a passing thing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The coronavirus-linked work stoppages and travel restrictions will have a material impact on global growth, Crisafulli recently predicted.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. So, lots to keep an eye on as we, um, navigate these uncertain waters.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. So, lots to keep an eye on as we, um, navigate these uncertain waters.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. Stay safe out there, everyone.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. Stay safe out there, everyone.
